docs.lead_paragraph: The Great Health Care Debate of 2009 has certainly had its share of wacky moments and wild assertions. But fears of death-panel bureaucrats voting to euthanize elderly Americans may pale in comparison to the latest fright point: according to a widely forwarded chain e-mail, the Democrats' health care bill would require anybody who enrolls in a new government-run health insurance plan "to have a data-receiving microchip implanted in their bodies."

headline.main: Revealed: No Robo-Patients in the Public Option

docs.abstract: The health care debate reaches a new level of nuttiness.
docs.snippet: The health care debate reaches a new level of nuttiness.

docs.lead_paragraph: The so-called Team of Ten Senate Democrats is meeting again in pursuit of an elusive deal on the proposed government-run insurance plan, or public option - and now it looks like the deal would be no public option, at least initially.

headline.main: Update: Senate Democrats May Be Backing Off Public Option

docs.abstract: Democratic senators, meeting privately, may be backing away from the idea of a government-run insurance plan.
docs.snippet: Democratic senators, meeting privately, may be backing away from the idea of a government-run insurance plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Organized labor has a new commercial urging centrist Democrats to eliminate the Senate's proposed tax on so-called Cadillac health insurance plans.

headline.main: A.F.L.-C.I.O. Pushes Back on Insurance Tax

docs.abstract: The A.F.L.-C.I.O. launches a campaign against the Senate's proposed tax on "Cadillac" health insurance plans.
docs.snippet: The A.F.L.-C.I.O. launches a campaign against the Senate's proposed tax on "Cadillac" health insurance plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: A liberal advocacy group is broadcasting a new television ad accusing Senator Joseph I. Lieberman, independent of Connecticut, of ignoring his constituents' needs by opposing the creation of a new government-run health insurance plan - the so-called public option.

headline.main: Prescriptions: Ad Jabs at Lieberman Over 'Public Option'

docs.abstract: A liberal advocacy group is broadcasting a new television ad accusing Senator Joseph I. Lieberman of ignoring his constituents' needs.
docs.snippet: A liberal advocacy group is broadcasting a new television ad accusing Senator Joseph I. Lieberman of ignoring his constituents' needs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The IssueInsurance coverage for abortions in the health care legislation.
docs.abstract: The Senate this grapples with another thorny controversy: funding for abortion. Here's where the debate stands.
docs.snippet: The Senate this grapples with another thorny controversy: funding for abortion. Here's where the debate stands.

docs.lead_paragraph: As political opera goes, the libretto seemed to be the vengeance of the vanquished.
docs.abstract: Meanwhile, in the Ohio Clock Corridor, Senator McCain offers dark thoughts on the 'hyper-partisan' ways of a former rival. . . .

docs.lead_paragraph: A liberal advocacy group is broadcasting a new television ad accusing Senator Joseph I. Lieberman, independent of Connecticut, of ignoring his constituents' needs by opposing the creation of a new government-run health insurance plan -- the so-called public option.

headline.main: Ad Jabs at Lieberman Over  'Public Option'

docs.abstract: A liberal advocacy group's TV ad says Lieberman's opposition to the public insurance option puts him at odds with Connecticut voters.
docs.snippet: A liberal advocacy group's TV ad says Lieberman's opposition to the public insurance option puts him at odds with Connecticut voters.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tuesday, Dec. 7, 1909(use this link to access today's entire issue)

headline.main: Insurer Bribed State Officials for 17 Years, Insurance Superindendent Charges

docs.abstract: The Phenix Fire Insurance Company evaded state investigation for the past 17 years by bribing former officials of the New York State Insurance Department with "loans," the department's superintendent, William H. Hotchkiss, says.
docs.snippet: The Phenix Fire Insurance Company evaded state investigation for the past 17 years by bribing former officials of the New York State Insurance Department with "loans," the department's superintendent, William H. Hotchkiss, says.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kenan Varin, who came to the United States with his mother six years ago for treatment for an intestinal disease, will undergo what doctors hope will be his last surgery.

headline.seo: Kenan Varin, 8, Hopes for Relief From Hirschsprung’s Disease
headline.main: The Neediest Cases: After Life of Surgeries, Hope for One Final Operation
